comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The 1915 Journal of Proceedings of the One Hundred and Twenty-Fifth Session of the Rhode Island Episcopal Convention books.google.com/books?id=JKE9AAAAYAAJ mentiond the Rev F.W. Crowder several times, including as Delegate to the Synod of New England. Perhaps the reason for his being in the Bain file at this time is that (as reported on page 79) he rtansferred to the Diocese of New York in April 1916. His name appears to be Frank Warfield Crowder and he had been Rector of Grace Church, Providence.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The 1890 photograph of Frank Warfield Crowder at archives.dickinson.edu/image-archive/frank-warfield-crowd... could certainly be the same man. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=87231527 gives him as born on June 6, 1869 and dying on Sept 27, 1932 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._James%27_Episcopal_Church_%28Ne... is the parish he moved to in 1916, and he stayed there (St. James Episcopal Church, New York City) until 1932, the year he died. His NYT obituary (Sept 28, 1932) -- [needs subscription] select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30A17FD3A551673... indicates that he died of "heart disease" while still rector of St. James.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: swanq, thanks for the additional information. We'll include his full name in our records.
